Description: A unique 8-digit identifier including the year (4 digits) and a sequential number (4 digits), and the ISO country code
Binary field specifying whether the disaster happened before 2000. Data before 2000 should be considered of lesser quality
A unique 15-character string identifying disasters in terms of the Group Subgroup Type and Subtype classification hierarchy
The disaster group, i.e., 'Natural' or 'Technological'
The disaster subgroup
The disaster type
The disaster subtype
List of identifiers pointing to external services and resources, such as the disaster Global Identifier (GLIDE) number
Short specification for disaster identification e.g. storm names (e.g. 'Mitch') plane type in air crash (e.g. 'Boeing 707') disease name (e.g. 'Cholera') or volcano name (e.g. 'Etna')
The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 3-letter code referring to the Country. The ISO 3166 norm is used
Country where the disaster occurred and had an impact using names from the UN M49 Standard
Subregion where the disaster occurred based on UN M49 standard
Region where the disaster occurred based on UN M49 standard
Geographical location name as specified in the sources e.g. city village department province state or district
Additional specifications on the contextual factors that led to the event e.g. 'heavy rains' for floods or 'drought' for a forest fire
List of secondary disaster types cascading from or co-occurring aside from the main type e.g. a landslide following a flood or an explosion after an earthquake
Binary field specifying whether or not the Office of US Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA) responded to the disaster
Binary field specifying whether or not there was a request for international assistance from the affected country
Binary field specifying whether a state of emergency was declared in the country

The total amount (in thousands of US$ at the time of the report) of contributions for immediate relief activities to the country in response to the disaster sourced from the Financial Tracking System of OCHA (1992 to 2015). Not maintained after 2015
A value related to the intensity of a hazard depending on the disaster type
The associated unit for the Magnitude column
North-South coordinates mainly for earthquakes and volcanic activity. Sometimes reported for floods landslides and storms (mostly when associated with floods)
East-West coordinates mainly for earthquakes and volcanic activity. Sometimes reported for floods landslides and storms (mostly when associated with floods)
Name of affected river basins typically used for floods
Year of occurrence of the disaster
Month of occurrence of the disaster
Day of occurrence of the disaster
Year of disaster conclusion
Month of conclusion of the disaster
Day of conclusion of the disaster
Total fatalities (deceased and missing combined)
Number of people with physical injuries, trauma or illness requiring immediate medical assistance due to the disaster
Number of people requiring shelter due to their house being destroyed or heavily damaged during the disaster
Total number of affected people (No. Injured No. Affected and No. Homeless combined)
Costs for replacement of lost assets in thousands of US dollars ('000 US$)
Reconstruction Costs ('000 US$), adjusted for inflation using the Consumer Price Index (CPI)
Economic damage covered by insurance companies in thousands of US dollars ('000 US$)
Insured Damage ('000 US$) adjusted for inflation using the Consumer Price Index (CPI)
Value of all economic losses directly or indirectly due to the disaster in thousands of US dollars ('000 US$)
Total Damage ('000 US$) adjusted for inflation using the Consumer Price Index (CPI)
Consumer Price Index from OECD used to adjust US$ values for inflation relative to Start Year

Collection of impacted Administrative Units from the FAO GAUL 2015 referential. Individual objects correspond to Level-1 or Level-2 Administrative Units. Geocoding is maintained for non-biological natural hazards from 2000 onwards
The day on which the event record was created in EM-DAT
The last date of modification of the event or one of its associated records in EM-DAT
